channel.title: Making a RSPS on windows 8!
channel.description: Ive been trying to make a RSPS on my new laptop, ive tryed downloading a source and a client from the server download page but everytime it downloads it loads up as just 1 file, it use to load up as a whole folder with both the source and client and extra files could someone help me with this. :o :)

item.title: Making a RSPS on windows 8!
item.dc:creator: @Roblix Roblix
item.description:
@Roblix wrote:

First.
Download and install WinRar. So you can unpack your .rar .zip files.
Then edit your runserver.bat or how ever its called.
You’'ll see something like this

@echo off
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_21\bin\javac.exe”
If you have an 64bit operating system. You should change \Program Files\ to \Program Files (x86)
Then check what version of JDK you got PS. you dont need JDK to run your server. Replace \jdk1.7.0_21\ with your JDK version. Or jre7 if you use normal java.

That should do it.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a RSPS on windows 8!
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

Seriously? Your operating system shouldn’t be a factor in ‘making a RSPS’ since your server/client will be written in Java.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a RSPS on windows 8!
item.dc:creator: @Frozen_Furyz Frozen Furyz
item.description:
@Frozen_Furyz wrote:

Thanks ill try that asap!

item.title: Making a RSPS on windows 8!
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

possibly its a rar or zip file and source&client are usually in one package sometimes… you have to extract the (.zip file or .rar file) using “winrar” and then it will show as a folder tried that?

Read full topic
